abstract.t: The document describes a mechanism allowing the use of Duplicate Address Detection (DAD) by IPv6 nodes in a VLAN N:1 with "split- horizon" model DSL architecture. Based on the DAD signalling, the first hop router stores all used addresses on the VLAN in a Binding Table. When a node performs DAD for an address already used by another node, the first hop router replies instead of this last one.
